Once you logon to the Jivox platform, you will find the People section on the left navigation. Below the People section there are three options: https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/managing-people

patterns: How can I edit a role
responses: Observers of an account can view most of the information associated with ads, campaigns and media plans. However, they are not able to edit any information or data. When you first enter an account, you will see an account dashboard with an overview of ads and campaigns for that account, as shown below.        https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/the-observer-role

When you manage a dynamic ad campaign with Jivox IQ, you define a set of components or building blocks that determine the ad layout, messaging, data signals, and rules. Jivox IQ uses these components to orchestrate the campaign at runtime. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/building-dynamic-ad-campaigns

patterns: How to add a new creative master
Problem with creating a new creative master
responses: If you want to specify different layouts to be dynamically replaced in a campaign, you can use creative masters. For example, you might have one layout with social icons and another with a social content feed. To implement this using Jivox IQ, you define one creative master that includes all the social icons and another creative master that includes the content feed. When you define creative masters in an ad, each one is mutually exclusive from other creative masters. In other words, only one creative master will be rendered for an ad impression. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/creative-masters

patterns: How to create a rich media ad
Problem in creating a rich media ad
What is the use of rich media ad
responses: You can use a rich media ad unit when you are designing a fixed-size ad layout. For more information on rich media ad unit types, see this guide from the IAB: http://www.iab.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/11/IAB_Display_Mobile_Creative_Guidelines_HTML5_2015.pdf.   When creating an ad, the different Rich Media ad units within the ad are all associated with distinct tags. For example, if an ad has a Medium Rectangle and Leaderboard, each of these will have a distinct tag so they can be trafficked to ad slots for those units. Multiple tags can use the same ad unit, but a single tag is typically assigned to a single ad unit. If you are setting up Responsive Ads, multiple ad units of the same type (for example, Leaderboard) can be included in one tag. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/creating-a-rich-media-ad-unit

patterns: Error generating element in jivox studio
responses: You can set up campaigns in Jivox IQ using an externally generated HTML5 creative. Each Jivox ad is comprised of one or more ad units. You can upload the HTML5 creative as a new ad or add it as an ad unit to an existing ad.      Jivox can accept any HTML5 creative, including HTML5 that is hand-coded or generated from other tools such as Adobe Animate CC or Google Web Designer. If you have generated HTML5 output using Adobe Edge Animate, Jivox also extracts the assets after the upload so you can configure individual elements to be dynamic or trigger interactions. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/work-with-html5-ads

You can create two basic campaign types in Jivox IQ: a single campaign or a dynamic campaign. Use a single campaign when the same ad is served to all users, with the ad unit varying by placement. Use a dynamic campaign to serve a data-driven campaign where the content of the ad is dynamically changed in real-time.   https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/creating-campaigns

When you define a dynamic campaign, you can customize the messaging based on data signals associated with the user, such as weather, city, holidays, or products previously viewed. You can also use rules to combine multiple data signals and map them to different databases to determine which creative asset to serve to the user. For example, you might use the data signal for weather to drive the background image and products previously viewed to personalize the text and images. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/define-a-dynamic-campaign

Deploying Jivox pixels on brand site enables you to correlate user activity on the brand site with a Jivox dynamic campaign. The two types of pixels that are supported are: Retargeting pixels to capture information about user activity on site. For example, you might track the last product browsed or placed in a shopping cart. For more details see Retargeting Pixels Conversion pixels to capture information about conversion events on site. For example, you might track creatives viewed before each product purchase. For more details see Conversion Pixels https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/about-tracking-site-activity

patterns: What are types of cookie data
responses: When you use the Personalization Hub, you can handle campaigns that require large amounts of cookie (first-party) data. For example, you might want to collect data about viewed product IDs, categories, sub-categories, and a shopping cart. The Personalization Hub lets you define and run campaigns that require: More than three cookie categories. More than five historical data points in a single category. This feature gives you maximum flexibility. For example, you could store the last ten car models viewed so those models appear in the viewer's image gallery. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/unlimited-cookie-data

patterns: How to add a new third party integration
responses: The Personalization Hub also allows you to handle third-party data integrations, including Data Management Platforms (DMPs) like BlueKai, LiveRamp, Krux, Neustar, Adobe, V12, and others. Contextual data like International Weather, Sport Scores, Page Categories, or any remote API hookup. Conversion data from third-party attribution partners like Abakus, Medialets, and Atlas. Viewability data like IAS (pre-integrated). Note: In some cases, additional CPMs apply for data. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/third-party-data-integration

patterns: How to track ads across platforms
responses: Using the Personalization Hub, you can take advantage of cross-device identity tracking across desktop, mobile web, and mobile in-app environments. You have two options. Cross-Device Retargeting. It's easy to leverage a user's site activity data across devices. When the user drops a cookie on the Desktop, you can use that cookie data on a mobile device to personalize the ad to the end user. For example, if a user might views a specific car model on a desktop device, you can show the same car on a mobile web or in-app ad.. Cross-Device Attribution. You can also track conversion across devices. When the user views a product ad on a mobile device and then buys the product on the desktop, Jivox tracks and attributes the conversion to the original ad on mobile web.. Note: Additional CPMs apply for cross-device identity data. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/cross-device-identity

To clone an ad into the same account in which the ad was created, follow these steps: 1- Access the list of Ads from the account dashboard by one of these ways: From the 'Ads' panel of the dashboard or By clicking the 'Ads' tab on the left navigation panel and selecting the submenu option 'Ads'. 2- From the ads listing, click onto the 'Clone Ads' icon under the 'Options' column, for the ad you want to clone. You will see a 'Clone Ads' card. 3- Select 'Clone into same account' and click onto the 'Clone Ad' button. 4- You will see a 'Clone Ad' dialog box displaying a confirmation message. Click onto the 'Ok' button. 5- You will be navigated to the 'Edit Ad' screen. Click onto the 'Copy Ad Unit' icon that appears next to the ad unit. You can copy individual base and expansion units separately. 6- Update the ad unit properties in the 'Copy Ad Unit' dialog box. 7- Click onto the 'Copy' button. The new ad unit appears in the ad, as shown below. 8- Click onto the 'Save Ad' button. The new ad appears in the ads panel of the dashboard as shown below. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/clone-an-account

patterns: What are the apis does jivox support
responses: You can design an HTML ad that leverages the Jivox standard API. Using these APIs, you can monitor events and trigger actions to integrate with Jivox ad rendering technology. You can also create an HTML widget with actions that are available to users to create interactions in Ad Studio while designing an ad. For example, you could enable configuration options for a count down start number, register a Play event, and a Reset actio https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/jivox-standard-apis

patterns: How to Put Dynamic api data
responses: Jivox enables developers to use APIs to access dynamic data for use in personalized ads. These APIs can return data from asset sources or from Jivox system data signals. There are three APIs available to work with Dynamic Data in Jivox: 1) getDynamicData This API returns the values of dynamic data signals for an ad impression. 2) getDynamicService This API provides more sophisticated options to look up one or more asset sources. 3) dynamicDataCallback This API provides the most flexible set of options to look up asset sources. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/jivox-dynamic-apis

patterns: How to Create DCO Ready Creative Master
responses: Learn what a Creative Master is and how to build Creative Masters and Dynamic Assets that are ready to be used in the Jivox IQ platform. This section is the right place to start for a creative team that will design the Creative Master ad template. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/about-jivox-iq-platforms

A Creative Master is a single, animated creative design with common elements that allows for multiple creative variations within that design. Creative variations can have different images and copy that appear based on specific dynamic triggers. An ad must include at least one creative master per ad size. There can be multiple creative masters per size that have different animations and numbers of frames. Below are two sets of creative masters in three ad sizes, made up of two frames each. Creative Master 1 is using one set of assets for the Female Hiking Sunny creative variation of this Trek brand ad. Creative Master 2 is another design, using assets for the Male- Running Cloudy variation. A new Creative Master is required when elements such as animation, number of frames, position of elements, additional images, and image sizes differ from the original creative master. In Creative Master 2, an additional orange rectangle has been added behind the headline text, the product image is cropped, and the CTA button has a different design. It may also animate differently, such as having the headline text slide in instead of fading in. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/What-is-a-Creative-Master

Assets can be text, images, and videos. Text or copy for each creative variation should be included in a spreadsheet. Images can be in JPG or PNG format. Video files should be in MP4 format. Below are assets for the 160x600 Trek ad. (Purple dashed line indicates transparent image bounds) n this example, there are 8 Background Image assets (4 shown), 4 Product Image assets, 8 text options for Product Name copy, 8 text options for Price copy, and 2 text options for Headline copy. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/What-are-Assets

A Creative Variation is based on a creative master, where specific text, images, or video are dynamically swapped out to form each variation. The selection of the creative variation could be based on rotation or driven by specified data conditions. Below are all creative variations for the 160x600 Trek ad, based on the original creative master. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/What-are-Creative-Variations

The formation of a personalized creative variation begins with the creative master that serves as the base design. Next, decisioning determines the appropriate assets to dynamically swap based on the data triggers. In this example, the data triggers are gender, interest, and weather The decisioning engine chooses: background image based on gender (male), interest (running) and weather sunny) product details image, name, price- based on gender (male) and interest (running) headline copy based on interest running) https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/Personalized-Dynamic-Creative-Visual-Workflow

The Jivox platform identifies images by their file names and text as their Symbol Names in the published Animate HTML file. ( Image feeds should not be used with Animate. ) Use consistent library asset, symbol, and instance names across sizes: f1_copy1, f1_copy2, bg1, bg2. Set live text elements as Dynamic Text if that text will be dynamically varied by the Jivox platform, and enter a unique Instance Name in the Properties panel. Convert dynamic text to Symbols prior to animation and set a matching Instance Name. Right-click Convert to Symbol... This enables the use of Scale to Fit and Vertical Align features in the platform. Google Fonts or custom web-safe fonts (see next page) should be used for dynamic text. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/Adobe-Animate-Setup

Images and text elements are dynamic-ready. The Jivox platform identifies images and text elements by their unique ID names as defined in the Properties panel. Images automatically get IDs based on filenames, while text element IDs need to be set. Use consistent dynamic element ID names across sizes:. f1copy1, f1_copy2, bg1, bg2, etc. Google Fonts or custom web-safe fonts (see next page) should be used for dynamic text. Wrapping/ Grouping Elements Multiple dynamic image and text elements can be Wrapped within a <div> element to animate together. Select two or more elements, Right-click the elements Wrap. Only static (non-dynamic) elements may be Grouped (Right-click> Create group..). Dynamic elements will not be dynamically swappable if grouped. Clickthrough Function (Click/Touch) Add one Tap Area element from the Components panel > Interaction folder and resize it as necessary. Right-click on Tap Area element, select Add event... Select Event Mouse> click, and Action: Custom. Enter function name after gwd, such as jivoxClick. Add jvxAd.openClickThrough0: in white input box. Follow the same steps for Event Touch touchend using the same Tap Area and jivoxClick function. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/Google-Web-Designer-Setup

Create a fonts folder within the project folder of your GWD HTML file. Within the fonts folder, include all available web-safe font file formats (TTF, wOFF, WOFF2, sVG). In the Code view, add a <style> tag with CSS @font-face declarations within the <head> element of the HTML file. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/Google-Web-Designer-Custom-Fonts

There are three APIs available to work with Dynamic Data in Jivox: 1) getDynamicData This API returns the values of dynamic data signals for an ad impression. 2) getDynamicService This API provides more sophisticated options to look up one or more asset sources. 3) dynamicDataCallback This API provides the most flexible set of options to look up asset sources. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/jivox-dynamic-apis

patterns: How to Create DCO Ready Creative Master
responses: Learn what a Creative Master is and how to build Creative Masters and Dynamic Assets that are ready to be used in the Jivox IQ platform. This section is the right place to start for a creative team that will design the Creative Master ad template. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/about-jivox-iq-platforms

A Creative Master is a single, animated creative design with common elements that allows for multiple creative variations within that design. Creative variations can have different images and copy that appear based on specific dynamic triggers. An ad must include at least one creative master per ad size. There can be multiple creative masters per size that have different animations and numbers of frames. Below are two sets of creative masters in three ad sizes, made up of two frames each. Creative Master 1 is using one set of assets for the Female Hiking Sunny creative variation of this Trek brand ad. Creative Master 2 is another design, using assets for the Male- Running Cloudy variation. A new Creative Master is required when elements such as animation, number of frames, position of elements, additional images, and image sizes differ from the original creative master. In Creative Master 2, an additional orange rectangle has been added behind the headline text, the product image is cropped, and the CTA button has a different design. It may also animate differently, such as having the headline text slide in instead of fading in. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/What-is-a-Creative-Master

Assets can be text, images, and videos. Text or copy for each creative variation should be included in a spreadsheet. Images can be in JPG or PNG format. Video files should be in MP4 format. Below are assets for the 160x600 Trek ad. (Purple dashed line indicates transparent image bounds) n this example, there are 8 Background Image assets (4 shown), 4 Product Image assets, 8 text options for Product Name copy, 8 text options for Price copy, and 2 text options for Headline copy. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/What-are-Assets

A Creative Variation is based on a creative master, where specific text, images, or video are dynamically swapped out to form each variation. The selection of the creative variation could be based on rotation or driven by specified data conditions. Below are all creative variations for the 160x600 Trek ad, based on the original creative master. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/What-are-Creative-Variations

The formation of a personalized creative variation begins with the creative master that serves as the base design. Next, decisioning determines the appropriate assets to dynamically swap based on the data triggers. In this example, the data triggers are gender, interest, and weather The decisioning engine chooses: background image based on gender (male), interest (running) and weather sunny) product details image, name, price- based on gender (male) and interest (running) headline copy based on interest running) https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/Personalized-Dynamic-Creative-Visual-Workflow

The Jivox platform identifies images by their file names and text as their Symbol Names in the published Animate HTML file. ( Image feeds should not be used with Animate. ) Use consistent library asset, symbol, and instance names across sizes: f1_copy1, f1_copy2, bg1, bg2. Set live text elements as Dynamic Text if that text will be dynamically varied by the Jivox platform, and enter a unique Instance Name in the Properties panel. Convert dynamic text to Symbols prior to animation and set a matching Instance Name. Right-click Convert to Symbol... This enables the use of Scale to Fit and Vertical Align features in the platform. Google Fonts or custom web-safe fonts (see next page) should be used for dynamic text. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/Adobe-Animate-Setup

Images and text elements are dynamic-ready. The Jivox platform identifies images and text elements by their unique ID names as defined in the Properties panel. Images automatically get IDs based on filenames, while text element IDs need to be set. Use consistent dynamic element ID names across sizes:. f1copy1, f1_copy2, bg1, bg2, etc. Google Fonts or custom web-safe fonts (see next page) should be used for dynamic text. Wrapping/ Grouping Elements Multiple dynamic image and text elements can be Wrapped within a <div> element to animate together. Select two or more elements, Right-click the elements Wrap. Only static (non-dynamic) elements may be Grouped (Right-click> Create group..). Dynamic elements will not be dynamically swappable if grouped. Clickthrough Function (Click/Touch) Add one Tap Area element from the Components panel > Interaction folder and resize it as necessary. Right-click on Tap Area element, select Add event... Select Event Mouse> click, and Action: Custom. Enter function name after gwd, such as jivoxClick. Add jvxAd.openClickThrough0: in white input box. Follow the same steps for Event Touch touchend using the same Tap Area and jivoxClick function. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/Google-Web-Designer-Setup

Create a fonts folder within the project folder of your GWD HTML file. Within the fonts folder, include all available web-safe font file formats (TTF, wOFF, WOFF2, sVG). In the Code view, add a <style> tag with CSS @font-face declarations within the <head> element of the HTML file. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/Google-Web-Designer-Custom-Fonts

patterns: Jivox Creative Master Export Setup (For DCS Support)
responses: Jivox enables personalization and interactions on the Custom HTML5 creatives if it follows Jivox Creative Master Export Format. Once the creative is uploaded into our platform, the individual components (images, text and its colors) are identified as dynamic elements. Specify the unique identifier (id) and type (data-el-type, image/text) for each dynamic element as shown below. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/jivox-creative-master-export-setup--for-dcs-support-

Imported image and video (footage) files are dynamic-ready (total file size less than 100MB). Imported footage files are identified in the AEPX and Jivox platform with the names as they appear in the Project panel in AE, where they can be modified. The files will retain their original names when collected into the project folder. Text layers should have unique layer names that map to column names in the asset source: copy1, copy2 Expressions should reference text layer index numbers instead of text layer names. Text layer names are changed when swapping source text dynamically, causing the reference in the expression to be invalid. Use Point Text elements for single-line copy or copy that with specific line breaks. Use Paragraph Text elements for multi-line copy that will auto-wrap, based on the bounding box. Reduce the project to only include assets and subcomps used by the main composition to be rendered. Select the main composition in the Project panel Go to File > Dependencies Reduce Project  https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/Adobe-After-Effects-Setup

Create a Text layer by selecting the Type Tool (CMD +T) and clicking (Point Text). Or go to Layer > New> Text, which creates a Point Text layer by default. Add any required line breaks to the asset source by yping Option +Return in a spreadsheet cell, as Point Text layers do not auto-wrap text to the next line. Enter the text to be displayed and adjust the styling (one font size, one style, no specific superscript or subscript characters, etc. per text element). Open the Transform» Scale property for the Text layer. Option+ click the Stopwatch icon and enter the following code in the expression input window on the timeline. Press the Num Enter key or click outside of the input window to save changes. Use the Anchor Point property expression for alignment if necessary. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/Adobe-After-Effects-Advanced-Features

Go to Assets Page and delete it

With the first option, designers can easily reuse existing HTML5 creatives in personalized ad campaigns. Designers can also continue to use their preferred creative design tools for the ad build, while leveraging the robust Jivox IQ backend infrastructure for personalizing ad campaigns at scale. With the second option, designer can use the Jivox IQ Ad Studio to design a creative from scratch. Designers can use built-in productivity enhancements like the Jivox EasyBuild widgets, dynamic text assets, and hotspots to create stunning ads without any coding, using an intuitive drag-and-drop interface. Refer this article for more info: https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/how-to-create-ad-and-ad-units

Managing accounts in Jivox IQ means creating and maintaining your team's accounts as well controlling user's access to, and permissions for, those accounts. Once you logon to the Jivox platform, you will find the accounts section on the left navigation. Below the accounts section there are two options- 'All Accounts' and 'Add New Account' https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/managing-accounts

The Accounts menu in the left navigation is to create a new account. Here, you simply enter the Account Name, Brand name and Organization. You cannot enter Labels, Prefix and Brand Data. If you have multiple organizations, make sure you select the right Organization that should get billed for the new Account. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/add-new-account

patterns: How to add new person to my account
responses: Managing People in Jivox IQ means creating and maintaining your team's user profiles and managing their account access, roles and permissions. Once you logon to the Jivox platform, you will find the People section on the left navigation. Below the People section there are three options: https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/managing-people

patterns: How can I edit a role
responses: Observers of an account can view most of the information associated with ads, campaigns and media plans. However, they are not able to edit any information or data. When you first enter an account, you will see an account dashboard with an overview of ads and campaigns for that account, as shown below.        https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/the-observer-role

When you manage a dynamic ad campaign with Jivox IQ, you define a set of components or building blocks that determine the ad layout, messaging, data signals, and rules. Jivox IQ uses these components to orchestrate the campaign at runtime. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/building-dynamic-ad-campaigns

patterns: How to add a new creative master
Problem with creating a new creative master
responses: If you want to specify different layouts to be dynamically replaced in a campaign, you can use creative masters. For example, you might have one layout with social icons and another with a social content feed. To implement this using Jivox IQ, you define one creative master that includes all the social icons and another creative master that includes the content feed. When you define creative masters in an ad, each one is mutually exclusive from other creative masters. In other words, only one creative master will be rendered for an ad impression. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/creative-masters

patterns: How to create a rich media ad
Problem in creating a rich media ad
What is the use of rich media ad
responses: You can use a rich media ad unit when you are designing a fixed-size ad layout. For more information on rich media ad unit types, see this guide from the IAB: http://www.iab.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/11/IAB_Display_Mobile_Creative_Guidelines_HTML5_2015.pdf.   When creating an ad, the different Rich Media ad units within the ad are all associated with distinct tags. For example, if an ad has a Medium Rectangle and Leaderboard, each of these will have a distinct tag so they can be trafficked to ad slots for those units. Multiple tags can use the same ad unit, but a single tag is typically assigned to a single ad unit. If you are setting up Responsive Ads, multiple ad units of the same type (for example, Leaderboard) can be included in one tag. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/creating-a-rich-media-ad-unit

patterns: Error generating element in jivox studio
responses: You can set up campaigns in Jivox IQ using an externally generated HTML5 creative. Each Jivox ad is comprised of one or more ad units. You can upload the HTML5 creative as a new ad or add it as an ad unit to an existing ad.      Jivox can accept any HTML5 creative, including HTML5 that is hand-coded or generated from other tools such as Adobe Animate CC or Google Web Designer. If you have generated HTML5 output using Adobe Edge Animate, Jivox also extracts the assets after the upload so you can configure individual elements to be dynamic or trigger interactions. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/work-with-html5-ads

You can create two basic campaign types in Jivox IQ: a single campaign or a dynamic campaign. Use a single campaign when the same ad is served to all users, with the ad unit varying by placement. Use a dynamic campaign to serve a data-driven campaign where the content of the ad is dynamically changed in real-time.   https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/creating-campaigns

When you define a dynamic campaign, you can customize the messaging based on data signals associated with the user, such as weather, city, holidays, or products previously viewed. You can also use rules to combine multiple data signals and map them to different databases to determine which creative asset to serve to the user. For example, you might use the data signal for weather to drive the background image and products previously viewed to personalize the text and images. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/define-a-dynamic-campaign

Deploying Jivox pixels on brand site enables you to correlate user activity on the brand site with a Jivox dynamic campaign. The two types of pixels that are supported are: Retargeting pixels to capture information about user activity on site. For example, you might track the last product browsed or placed in a shopping cart. For more details see Retargeting Pixels Conversion pixels to capture information about conversion events on site. For example, you might track creatives viewed before each product purchase. For more details see Conversion Pixels https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/about-tracking-site-activity

patterns: What are types of cookie data
responses: When you use the Personalization Hub, you can handle campaigns that require large amounts of cookie (first-party) data. For example, you might want to collect data about viewed product IDs, categories, sub-categories, and a shopping cart. The Personalization Hub lets you define and run campaigns that require: More than three cookie categories. More than five historical data points in a single category. This feature gives you maximum flexibility. For example, you could store the last ten car models viewed so those models appear in the viewer's image gallery. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/unlimited-cookie-data

patterns: How to add a new third party integration
responses: The Personalization Hub also allows you to handle third-party data integrations, including Data Management Platforms (DMPs) like BlueKai, LiveRamp, Krux, Neustar, Adobe, V12, and others. Contextual data like International Weather, Sport Scores, Page Categories, or any remote API hookup. Conversion data from third-party attribution partners like Abakus, Medialets, and Atlas. Viewability data like IAS (pre-integrated). Note: In some cases, additional CPMs apply for data. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/third-party-data-integration

patterns: How to track ads across platforms
responses: Using the Personalization Hub, you can take advantage of cross-device identity tracking across desktop, mobile web, and mobile in-app environments. You have two options. Cross-Device Retargeting. It's easy to leverage a user's site activity data across devices. When the user drops a cookie on the Desktop, you can use that cookie data on a mobile device to personalize the ad to the end user. For example, if a user might views a specific car model on a desktop device, you can show the same car on a mobile web or in-app ad.. Cross-Device Attribution. You can also track conversion across devices. When the user views a product ad on a mobile device and then buys the product on the desktop, Jivox tracks and attributes the conversion to the original ad on mobile web.. Note: Additional CPMs apply for cross-device identity data. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/cross-device-identity

To clone an ad into the same account in which the ad was created, follow these steps: 1- Access the list of Ads from the account dashboard by one of these ways: From the 'Ads' panel of the dashboard or By clicking the 'Ads' tab on the left navigation panel and selecting the submenu option 'Ads'. 2- From the ads listing, click onto the 'Clone Ads' icon under the 'Options' column, for the ad you want to clone. You will see a 'Clone Ads' card. 3- Select 'Clone into same account' and click onto the 'Clone Ad' button. 4- You will see a 'Clone Ad' dialog box displaying a confirmation message. Click onto the 'Ok' button. 5- You will be navigated to the 'Edit Ad' screen. Click onto the 'Copy Ad Unit' icon that appears next to the ad unit. You can copy individual base and expansion units separately. 6- Update the ad unit properties in the 'Copy Ad Unit' dialog box. 7- Click onto the 'Copy' button. The new ad unit appears in the ad, as shown below. 8- Click onto the 'Save Ad' button. The new ad appears in the ads panel of the dashboard as shown below. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/clone-an-account

patterns: What are the apis does jivox support
responses: You can design an HTML ad that leverages the Jivox standard API. Using these APIs, you can monitor events and trigger actions to integrate with Jivox ad rendering technology. You can also create an HTML widget with actions that are available to users to create interactions in Ad Studio while designing an ad. For example, you could enable configuration options for a count down start number, register a Play event, and a Reset actio https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/jivox-standard-apis

Use a dynamic campaign to serve a data-driven campaign where the content of the ad is dynamically changed in real-time.   https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/creating-campaigns

When you define a dynamic campaign, you can customize the messaging based on data signals associated with the user, such as weather, city, holidays, or products previously viewed. You can also use rules to combine multiple data signals and map them to different databases to determine which creative asset to serve to the user. For example, you might use the data signal for weather to drive the background image and products previously viewed to personalize the text and images. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/define-a-dynamic-campaign

Deploying Jivox pixels on brand site enables you to correlate user activity on the brand site with a Jivox dynamic campaign. The two types of pixels that are supported are: Retargeting pixels to capture information about user activity on site. For example, you might track the last product browsed or placed in a shopping cart. For more details see Retargeting Pixels Conversion pixels to capture information about conversion events on site. For example, you might track creatives viewed before each product purchase. For more details see Conversion Pixels https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/about-tracking-site-activity

patterns: What are types of cookie data
responses: When you use the Personalization Hub, you can handle campaigns that require large amounts of cookie (first-party) data. For example, you might want to collect data about viewed product IDs, categories, sub-categories, and a shopping cart. The Personalization Hub lets you define and run campaigns that require: More than three cookie categories. More than five historical data points in a single category. This feature gives you maximum flexibility. For example, you could store the last ten car models viewed so those models appear in the viewer's image gallery. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/unlimited-cookie-data

patterns: How to add a new third party integration
responses: The Personalization Hub also allows you to handle third-party data integrations, including Data Management Platforms (DMPs) like BlueKai, LiveRamp, Krux, Neustar, Adobe, V12, and others. Contextual data like International Weather, Sport Scores, Page Categories, or any remote API hookup. Conversion data from third-party attribution partners like Abakus, Medialets, and Atlas. Viewability data like IAS (pre-integrated). Note: In some cases, additional CPMs apply for data. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/third-party-data-integration

patterns: How to track ads across platforms
responses: Using the Personalization Hub, you can take advantage of cross-device identity tracking across desktop, mobile web, and mobile in-app environments. You have two options. Cross-Device Retargeting. It's easy to leverage a user's site activity data across devices. When the user drops a cookie on the Desktop, you can use that cookie data on a mobile device to personalize the ad to the end user. For example, if a user might views a specific car model on a desktop device, you can show the same car on a mobile web or in-app ad.. Cross-Device Attribution. You can also track conversion across devices. When the user views a product ad on a mobile device and then buys the product on the desktop, Jivox tracks and attributes the conversion to the original ad on mobile web.. Note: Additional CPMs apply for cross-device identity data. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/cross-device-identity

To clone an ad into the same account in which the ad was created, follow these steps: 1- Access the list of Ads from the account dashboard by one of these ways: From the 'Ads' panel of the dashboard or By clicking the 'Ads' tab on the left navigation panel and selecting the submenu option 'Ads'. 2- From the ads listing, click onto the 'Clone Ads' icon under the 'Options' column, for the ad you want to clone. You will see a 'Clone Ads' card. 3- Select 'Clone into same account' and click onto the 'Clone Ad' button. 4- You will see a 'Clone Ad' dialog box displaying a confirmation message. Click onto the 'Ok' button. 5- You will be navigated to the 'Edit Ad' screen. Click onto the 'Copy Ad Unit' icon that appears next to the ad unit. You can copy individual base and expansion units separately. 6- Update the ad unit properties in the 'Copy Ad Unit' dialog box. 7- Click onto the 'Copy' button. The new ad unit appears in the ad, as shown below. 8- Click onto the 'Save Ad' button. The new ad appears in the ads panel of the dashboard as shown below. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/clone-an-account

patterns: What are the apis does jivox support
responses: You can design an HTML ad that leverages the Jivox standard API. Using these APIs, you can monitor events and trigger actions to integrate with Jivox ad rendering technology. You can also create an HTML widget with actions that are available to users to create interactions in Ad Studio while designing an ad. For example, you could enable configuration options for a count down start number, register a Play event, and a Reset actio https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/jivox-standard-apis

patterns: How to Put Dynamic api data
responses: Jivox enables developers to use APIs to access dynamic data for use in personalized ads. These APIs can return data from asset sources or from Jivox system data signals. There are three APIs available to work with Dynamic Data in Jivox: 1) getDynamicData This API returns the values of dynamic data signals for an ad impression. 2) getDynamicService This API provides more sophisticated options to look up one or more asset sources. 3) dynamicDataCallback This API provides the most flexible set of options to look up asset sources. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/jivox-dynamic-apis

patterns: How to Create DCO Ready Creative Master
responses: Learn what a Creative Master is and how to build Creative Masters and Dynamic Assets that are ready to be used in the Jivox IQ platform. This section is the right place to start for a creative team that will design the Creative Master ad template. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/about-jivox-iq-platforms

A Creative Master is a single, animated creative design with common elements that allows for multiple creative variations within that design. Creative variations can have different images and copy that appear based on specific dynamic triggers. An ad must include at least one creative master per ad size. There can be multiple creative masters per size that have different animations and numbers of frames. Below are two sets of creative masters in three ad sizes, made up of two frames each. Creative Master 1 is using one set of assets for the Female Hiking Sunny creative variation of this Trek brand ad. Creative Master 2 is another design, using assets for the Male- Running Cloudy variation. A new Creative Master is required when elements such as animation, number of frames, position of elements, additional images, and image sizes differ from the original creative master. In Creative Master 2, an additional orange rectangle has been added behind the headline text, the product image is cropped, and the CTA button has a different design. It may also animate differently, such as having the headline text slide in instead of fading in. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/What-is-a-Creative-Master

Assets can be text, images, and videos. Text or copy for each creative variation should be included in a spreadsheet. Images can be in JPG or PNG format. Video files should be in MP4 format. Below are assets for the 160x600 Trek ad. (Purple dashed line indicates transparent image bounds) n this example, there are 8 Background Image assets (4 shown), 4 Product Image assets, 8 text options for Product Name copy, 8 text options for Price copy, and 2 text options for Headline copy. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/What-are-Assets

A Creative Variation is based on a creative master, where specific text, images, or video are dynamically swapped out to form each variation. The selection of the creative variation could be based on rotation or driven by specified data conditions. Below are all creative variations for the 160x600 Trek ad, based on the original creative master. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/What-are-Creative-Variations

The formation of a personalized creative variation begins with the creative master that serves as the base design. Next, decisioning determines the appropriate assets to dynamically swap based on the data triggers. In this example, the data triggers are gender, interest, and weather The decisioning engine chooses: background image based on gender (male), interest (running) and weather sunny) product details image, name, price- based on gender (male) and interest (running) headline copy based on interest running) https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/Personalized-Dynamic-Creative-Visual-Workflow

The Jivox platform identifies images by their file names and text as their Symbol Names in the published Animate HTML file. ( Image feeds should not be used with Animate. ) Use consistent library asset, symbol, and instance names across sizes: f1_copy1, f1_copy2, bg1, bg2. Set live text elements as Dynamic Text if that text will be dynamically varied by the Jivox platform, and enter a unique Instance Name in the Properties panel. Convert dynamic text to Symbols prior to animation and set a matching Instance Name. Right-click Convert to Symbol... This enables the use of Scale to Fit and Vertical Align features in the platform. Google Fonts or custom web-safe fonts (see next page) should be used for dynamic text. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/Adobe-Animate-Setup

Images and text elements are dynamic-ready. The Jivox platform identifies images and text elements by their unique ID names as defined in the Properties panel. Images automatically get IDs based on filenames, while text element IDs need to be set. Use consistent dynamic element ID names across sizes:. f1copy1, f1_copy2, bg1, bg2, etc. Google Fonts or custom web-safe fonts (see next page) should be used for dynamic text. Wrapping/ Grouping Elements Multiple dynamic image and text elements can be Wrapped within a <div> element to animate together. Select two or more elements, Right-click the elements Wrap. Only static (non-dynamic) elements may be Grouped (Right-click> Create group..). Dynamic elements will not be dynamically swappable if grouped. Clickthrough Function (Click/Touch) Add one Tap Area element from the Components panel > Interaction folder and resize it as necessary. Right-click on Tap Area element, select Add event... Select Event Mouse> click, and Action: Custom. Enter function name after gwd, such as jivoxClick. Add jvxAd.openClickThrough0: in white input box. Follow the same steps for Event Touch touchend using the same Tap Area and jivoxClick function. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/Google-Web-Designer-Setup

Create a fonts folder within the project folder of your GWD HTML file. Within the fonts folder, include all available web-safe font file formats (TTF, wOFF, WOFF2, sVG). In the Code view, add a <style> tag with CSS @font-face declarations within the <head> element of the HTML file. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/Google-Web-Designer-Custom-Fonts

patterns: Jivox Creative Master Export Setup (For DCS Support)
responses: Jivox enables personalization and interactions on the Custom HTML5 creatives if it follows Jivox Creative Master Export Format. Once the creative is uploaded into our platform, the individual components (images, text and its colors) are identified as dynamic elements. Specify the unique identifier (id) and type (data-el-type, image/text) for each dynamic element as shown below. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/jivox-creative-master-export-setup--for-dcs-support-

Imported image and video (footage) files are dynamic-ready (total file size less than 100MB). Imported footage files are identified in the AEPX and Jivox platform with the names as they appear in the Project panel in AE, where they can be modified. The files will retain their original names when collected into the project folder. Text layers should have unique layer names that map to column names in the asset source: copy1, copy2 Expressions should reference text layer index numbers instead of text layer names. Text layer names are changed when swapping source text dynamically, causing the reference in the expression to be invalid. Use Point Text elements for single-line copy or copy that with specific line breaks. Use Paragraph Text elements for multi-line copy that will auto-wrap, based on the bounding box. Reduce the project to only include assets and subcomps used by the main composition to be rendered. Select the main composition in the Project panel Go to File > Dependencies Reduce Project  https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/Adobe-After-Effects-Setup

Create a Text layer by selecting the Type Tool (CMD +T) and clicking (Point Text). Or go to Layer > New> Text, which creates a Point Text layer by default. Add any required line breaks to the asset source by yping Option +Return in a spreadsheet cell, as Point Text layers do not auto-wrap text to the next line. Enter the text to be displayed and adjust the styling (one font size, one style, no specific superscript or subscript characters, etc. per text element). Open the Transform» Scale property for the Text layer. Option+ click the Stopwatch icon and enter the following code in the expression input window on the timeline. Press the Num Enter key or click outside of the input window to save changes. Use the Anchor Point property expression for alignment if necessary. https://userguides.jivox.com/jivox-user-guide/Adobe-After-Effects-Advanced-Features

With the first option, designers can easily reuse existing HTML5 creatives in personalized ad campaigns. Designers can also continue to use their preferred creative design tools for the ad build, while leveraging the robust Jivox IQ backend infrastructure for personalizing ad campaigns at scale. With the second option, designer can use the Jivox IQ Ad Studio to design a creative from scratch. Designers can use built-in productivity enhancements like the Jivox EasyBuild widgets, dynamic text assets, and hotspots to create stunning ads without any coding, using an intuitive drag-and-drop interface. Refer this article for more info: https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/how-to-create-ad-and-ad-units

Managing accounts in Jivox IQ means creating and maintaining your team's accounts as well controlling user's access to, and permissions for, those accounts. Once you logon to the Jivox platform, you will find the accounts section on the left navigation. Below the accounts section there are two options- 'All Accounts' and 'Add New Account' https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/managing-accounts

The Accounts menu in the left navigation is to create a new account. Here, you simply enter the Account Name, Brand name and Organization. You cannot enter Labels, Prefix and Brand Data. If you have multiple organizations, make sure you select the right Organization that should get billed for the new Account. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/add-new-account

Below the People section there are three options: https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/managing-people

patterns: How can I edit a role
responses: Observers of an account can view most of the information associated with ads, campaigns and media plans. However, they are not able to edit any information or data. When you first enter an account, you will see an account dashboard with an overview of ads and campaigns for that account, as shown below.        https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/the-observer-role

Jivox IQ uses these components to orchestrate the campaign at runtime. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/building-dynamic-ad-campaigns

patterns: How to add a new creative master
Problem with creating a new creative master
responses: If you want to specify different layouts to be dynamically replaced in a campaign, you can use creative masters. For example, you might have one layout with social icons and another with a social content feed. To implement this using Jivox IQ, you define one creative master that includes all the social icons and another creative master that includes the content feed. When you define creative masters in an ad, each one is mutually exclusive from other creative masters. In other words, only one creative master will be rendered for an ad impression. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/creative-masters

patterns: How to create a rich media ad
Problem in creating a rich media ad
What is the use of rich media ad
responses: You can use a rich media ad unit when you are designing a fixed-size ad layout. For more information on rich media ad unit types, see this guide from the IAB: http://www.iab.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/11/IAB_Display_Mobile_Creative_Guidelines_HTML5_2015.pdf.   When creating an ad, the different Rich Media ad units within the ad are all associated with distinct tags. For example, if an ad has a Medium Rectangle and Leaderboard, each of these will have a distinct tag so they can be trafficked to ad slots for those units. Multiple tags can use the same ad unit, but a single tag is typically assigned to a single ad unit. If you are setting up Responsive Ads, multiple ad units of the same type (for example, Leaderboard) can be included in one tag. https://docs.jivox.com/jivox-documentation/creating-a-rich-media-ad-unit
